page.title: 05PROCESS TO OBTAIN CHINA CLAY
page.content: When the decomposed granite is washed out it is made up of three main things,apart from the water.These are the china clay,sand and mica.The sand separates out fairly easily because it is heavier.Then the mica has to be separated by a more complicated process,using 'hydroclones'.This allows the china clay to be taken away as a suspension.The residue from this process is taken away to the mica storage lagoon.The suspension of china clay in water is then gravity fed by pipe to the drying plant at Marsh Mills.At Marsh Mills the china clay is dried in stages to get rid of much of the water and separate out the different grades of china clay.The best quality clay is then taken back upto Lee Moor,where it is processed further.
